intro: Cyclospermum leptophyllum var. latisectum, commonly known as the broad-leafed cyclospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
